utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I must say, Leonard, when I first heard your idea for Giant Jenga, I was sceptical.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t blame you. Tiny Twister was a complete bust.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I was wrong. The looming threat of being crushed under a pile of lumber does add a certain spice. I’ve never felt so alive. Oh, hello, Alex. Uh, let me go get you last night’s recordings.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What recordings?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you remember when you told me I talk in my sleep? Well, it occurred to me that, like most things I say, it’s probably pure gold. So I started recording it all, and now Alex gets to comb through eight hours of what I like to call Sheldon After Dark.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. Just playing a little Giant Jenga here.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Oh, I know, I’m the one who had to buy him the helmet. So, do you have any plans this weekend?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, most of Saturday’s gonna be figuring out where to put this game when we’re done. How about you?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Oh, I’m gonna go see Kip Thorne give a lecture on subatomic space-time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ooh. That’s his take on John Wheeler’s quantum foam. That should be great.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Well, if you want, you can come with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, I’d love to, but I’m supposed to hang out with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Well, bring her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, she’s not really into that kind of stuff.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. Well, if you want to hear about the lecture, I can tell you all about it at work, or, you know, over dinner sometime.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (jumping and knocking over the Jenga)
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Jenga, I win!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, that can’t be true.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I did the research. Tony the Tiger, Dig’em the Frog, Cap’n Crunch, Toucan Sam, Count Chocula, Trix the Rabbit, Snap, Crackle and Pop. Not one cereal mascot is a girl. It’s a total breakfast sausage fest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are we done with this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Almost. Franken Berry, Boo Berry, Sugar Bear and the Honey Nut Cheerio bee, I believe his name is Buzz.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Terrific. Something weird happened and I don’t know what to do about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s assistant asked me on a date last night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How could you do that to me? You know I’ve been working it with Alex for weeks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Working it? You can’t even talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I talk with my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You look like my little cousin when he’s dropping one in his diaper.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She knows I have a girlfriend. It’s so weird.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God. You’re loving this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To my bones. I mean, I’m not gonna do anything about it. I love Penny. It’s just nice to have a young, attractive woman sniffing around the goods.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I both hate you and want to be you. This is Ryan Gosling all over again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, gentlemen, what is on the conversational menu this morning?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Leonard stole my woman, and he knew full well I was only six to eight months away from making my move.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t steal anyone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Your assistant is totally hitting on this jerk and he loves it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s not acceptable. I mean, I’m her boss. She needs to be solely focused on my needs, not distracted by your pasty, androgynous brand of sexuality.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m androgynous?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please. Look at you with your pouty bee-stung lips.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you guys think I should do?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I say you tell Alex your heart belongs to Penny, I provide her a shoulder to cry on, and then roughly half a year later I give it to her good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want to thank you all for coming on such short notice. Uh, in the past, I’ve reached out to each of you individually, but I believe my present situation requires the collective wisdom of the group, which as you can see from your commemorative T-shirts I have dubbed Sheldon Cooper’s Council of Ladies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need your advice about a delicate workplace situation. Uh, to protect those involved, I’ll be changing their names.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who’s involved?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, a short, bespectacled colleague of mine who lives in the shadow of his brilliant roommate. Let’s call this colleague Ricardo Shilly-Shally.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re talking about Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, Shilly-Shally has red hair and, uh, he briefly served in the Mexican Navy. Anyway, despite the fact that he has a girlfriend, Shilly-Shally has been the recipient of inappropriate workplace flirtations from a young lady.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s your assistant Alex, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No. No. This is Tondelaya della Ventimiglia.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, what the hell’s going on with Leonard and Alex?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, uh, no, I’m sorry. Who’s talking about Leonard and Alex?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. Ricardo and Tondelaya.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, look, it’s not really about Ricardo and Tondelaya. It is really about her boss, who doesn’t quite know how to handle this situation and could use your advice, which is surprising because Dr. Einstein Von Brainstorm, he’s usually pretty smart about these things.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m gonna kill her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m sure you’ve got nothing to worry about. Leonard would never cheat on you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She’s right. But say the word, I got a lab full of cocaine-addicted monkeys with nothing to lose. One of them could end up in the backseat of her car. Or her shower.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ladies, ladies, please. We’re not here to talk about Penny, okay? We’re here to talk about me. Uh, I mean Einstein Von Brainstorm. Oh, darn it! All right, I guess the cat’s out of the bag. Let me explain what’s going on. Ricardo is really Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We know what’s going on, Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, what should I do?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, Alex is your employee. If she’s doing something that’s making Leonard uncomfortable, you should talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, he’s not uncomfortable at all. No, he’s loving it. Yeah, he’s strutting around like he’s five-foot-six.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? He’s loving it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sheldon, you need to talk to Alex right away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Talk to her? That’s all you’ve got? With a cool name like Sheldon Cooper’s Council of Ladies, I really expected more. Give me back the T-shirts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alex, check my schedule. What does my afternoon look like?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: I think it’s pretty wide open. Oh, wait. Here’s something at four o’clock. Give Alex a talking to?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that snuck up on us, didn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s not call it a problem. Let’s call it an opportunity. To solve a serious problem.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t know? Oh, you poor dear. Your ovaries are squirting so much goofy juice into your brains you don’t even know which way is up. You made an inappropriate sexual advance towards Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What? I didn’t make a sexual advance on anybody.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, there’s no need to get defensive. I’m not unsympathetic to your plight. My father used to say that a woman is like an egg salad sandwich on a warm Texas day.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Full of eggs and only appealing for a short time.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: This conversation is making me uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, you and me both, sister. Now, please understand, I don’t hold you responsible for your behaviour because, see, from an evolutionary standpoint, you’re a slave to your desire to reproduce. But during the work day, when you feel possessed by amorous intent, may I suggest that you suppress it by leafing through this illustrated book of sexually transmitted diseases? Let’s see here. Oh, yes. Check out this oozy doozy.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So does this fellow, but he can’t without it burning like hot soup.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, pretty lady.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you seem extra happy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I guess I am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Any particular reason why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, just having a good day. This morning Sheldon fell asleep on the way to work, so I got to listen to the radio. That was pretty crazy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Anything else?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm. I found this quiz online called Which Star Trek Character Are You? and it only took me four tries to get Captain Kirk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. It. Was.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm. Well, I’m glad you’re having such a great day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. And the one thing that could make it even better is an evening with my special girl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, and who’s that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I just didn’t know if you meant me or Alex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, why would I mean Alex?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because I know she hit on you and I know you liked it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t play dumb with me, Ricardo Shilly-Shally!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m missing something. Did you say something to Penny about Alex?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes. Yeah, and a fat lot of good it did me. All she did was get mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I needed advice about a woman. I would have asked you, but if the last few years have proven anything, it’s that you can’t tell a uterus from a unicycle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: At least I know not to blab to a girl about somebody flirting with her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good to know. Yeah, a few more helpful hints like that, you may find yourself on the Council of Ladies. Hello. I see. Uh, what time? Very well, then. Huh. That was the Human Resources Department at the university. Apparently, my assistant Alex has filed a complaint accusing me of inappropriate behaviour in the workplace.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm, let me think. Nothing. I’m a delight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Human Resources Department. Human Resources Department. Human Resources Department.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: Ah, Dr. Cooper, have a seat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: I called you in today because your assistant Alex Jensen has lodged a complaint against you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So I’ve been told. But I can’t understand what she has to complain about. I mean, she has a front-row seat as I make scientific history. There’s string cheese in my mini-fridge, and that’s for anyone. Yeah, and just yesterday I led her away from a life of sexual promiscuity by making her look at pictures of disease-ridden genitalia.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: Cancel my next appointment. This is gonna take a while. Dr. Cooper, you said things to your employee that you just cannot say in the workplace.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: Well, according to Ms. Jensen, you said that she was a slave to her biological urges and called her an egg salad sandwich. I don’t even know what that means, but I’m gonna go ahead and tell you you can’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh! I see the confusion here. No, no, Alex thought I was singling her out. No. I meant that all women are slaves to their biological urges, you know? Even you. You’re a slave.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: I’m a what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, y-you, I-I’m just saying, you know, at a certain point in a woman’s menstrual cycle…

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: Whuh-ah! Woah! You can’t talk about that, either, Dr. Cooper. Your language is entirely inappropriate, and I’m gonna advise that you shut your mouth right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see why I’m the one being persecuted here. Dr. Hofstadter, he was bragging about his sexual desirability to anyone who would listen. You know, and Howard Wolowitz, he spent two years using university resources building a six-breasted sex robot. Oh, and at the office Christmas party, I heard Rajesh Koothrappali refer to you several times as Brown Sugar.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman (writing)
utterance.content: Hofstadter… Wolowitz… and the last one was Rajesh Koothrappali?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. No, yeah, but in his defense, that wasn’t racist. He’s also brown.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (singing)
utterance.content: I’m sorry Alex hit on me, hit on me, hit on me. I’m sorry Alex hit on me, I’d no idea I’m cute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, damn it, you are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Please forgive me. I should have told you about Alex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t care about Alex. Fine, I care. Okay, I hate that bitch. But what really hurt is that you liked it so much. I mean, do I need to be worried?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course not. No. Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because, she is pretty and smart, and when you talk about work, she doesn’t have to go home and look up words in the dictionary to understand what you said.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. Are you feeling insecure? Because that’s my thing, and if you take it away, I don’t know what I’m bringing to this relationship.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, Leonard, I am insecure. Happy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I’m not happy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why are you smiling?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I just never think of you having feelings like that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why? Nothing is ever going to happen between me and Alex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come here. Tell you a secret?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: With all these women chasing me, I kind of do feel like Captain Kirk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can I tell you a secret?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Keep talking about Captain Kirk, and we’re all gonna stop.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Message received. Ah, excuse me. Hello. This is Dr. Hofstadter. Okay. All right, thank you. That’s weird. I’m getting called in to Human Resources.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Huh. I just got called in to Human Resources.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Huh. That is so strange. Human Resources wants to talk to me tomorrow. Could you stop licking your ass for two minutes? I have a problem here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you really think you should be drinking right now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How else am I supposed to talk to the Human Resources lady?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Seek professional help?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I did. The guy at the liquor store said this stuff tastes great in coffee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait, you got called in, too? What is going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon threw us all under the bus.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I feel like I’ve been called down to the principal’s office. Although I wouldn’t mind if Brown Sugar suspended me. From a sex swing. This may have been a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Relax. Everything’s gonna be fine. Before I met Bernadette I was in here every other day. Uh, little tip, turn off your I Like Big Butts ringtone before you go in.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, this is all your fault.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How is this my fault?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you weren’t screwing around with Sheldon’s assistant, none of this would be happening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wasn’t screwing around with anyone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, of course not. She was just sniffing around your goods because she was hunting for truffles.

utterance.speaker: HR Woman
utterance.content: Ah, Mr. Wolowitz, it’s been a while.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Janine. How are Tom and the kids?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Fine. You must be Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, but I think this is all a big misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, me, too. I didn’t do anything.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Is that alcohol on your breath?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard built a sex robot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That is not true. All I did was build a robot.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Did it have six breasts?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m a feminist, I don’t notice things like how many breasts a robot has.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I came to speak to Mrs. Davis.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: And I’m a little busy right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I came to file a complaint. Somebody has made me feel uncomfortable in the workplace by using language of an inappropriate and sexual nature.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: And who was that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You, you dirty birdie. I-I thought about the things you said to me yesterday, and I realized I’m deeply offended. Now, be a dear and get me one of those complaint forms.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: That’s it. All of you, in my office now!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And thanks to you, I know better than to ask if you’re menstruating. And based on your behaviour, I don’t have to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It has been pointed out to me that some of the things I said to you could be construed as offensive, and I would like to offer you my sincerest apology.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, additionally, you should know that the university has mandated that I take an online sexual harassment seminar so this sort of thing doesn’t happen in the future.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Now, unfortunately, uh, my time is much too valuable to waste on nonsense like this, so, um, I’m gonna need you to take it for me. Oh, and, uh, you’d better ace it, they’re pretty mad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, hey, I was thinking about that stuff with Alex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, would you stop worrying about that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t help it. But, look, I figured I could sit around and feel insecure, or I could do something about it. So I got a course catalogue at school and looked at some of the science classes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it isn’t, they are extremely boring. I mean, how do you not kill yourself, like, every day? Anyway, I decided I don’t need to be a scientist, I could just look like one. So I bought these.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Glasses? I really don’t think that’s gonna change… oh, my God, you look so smart and hot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know, right? Watch this. Molecules.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, come with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To my bedroom, so I can take everything off but those glasses. And maybe the boots.
